raw_text:
The One in Barbados: Part 1
Written by: Andrew Reich & Ted Cohen   Transcribed by: Coffee Mug

lines.speaker: The One in Barbados
lines.text: Part 1

lines.speaker: Written by
lines.text: Andrew Reich & Ted Cohen   Transcribed by: Coffee Mug

scene_description: Monica and Chandler's Room. They both enter from Ross's   room. Monica still has her big, frizzy hair.
raw_text:
[Scene: Barbados, Monica and Chandler's Room. They both enter from Ross's   room. Monica still has her big, frizzy hair.]
Monica: Oh, the way you crushed Mike at ping pong was such   a turn-on.You wanna...? (plays with her finger on Chandlers chest)
Chandler: You know, I'd love to, but I'm a little tired.
Monica: I'll put a pillowcase over my head.
Chandler: You're on!
(they start to get ready, but then Phoebe enters through the door from Ross's   room)
Phoebe: Hey!
Monica: What's up?
Phoebe: Well, okay, Mike's taking a shower, which by the   way there's  no law against. And then we're gonna grab some food, so if you   want...
(there's a door slamming in Ross's room, and some indistinct murmuring)
Ross: ... finally...
Phoebe: Is that Ross?
Monica: Yeah, you can hear everything through these stupid   walls.
Phoebe: Sounds like he's with someone.
Chandler: He could be alone. This morning I heard him do   push-ups, and then talk to his triceps.
Monica: Wait a minute, I think Phoebe's right. You know I   hear someone else in there with him.
(they all put their ear against the wall to be able to hear what's   being said. We move to Ross's room where he and Charlie are kissing.)
Charlie: Ooh... Dr. Geller!
Ross: God, you're amazing... I didn't even have to ask you   to call me that.
Monica: Oh my God, that's Charlie!
Chandler: She's cheating on Joey with Ross!
Phoebe: Oh that tart... floozy... giant...
Monica: I'm not sure about this.
Phoebe: Yeah, you're right. This is none of our business.
Monica: No I'm not sure that it's  the best way to hear   everything. Someone get me a glass!
Phoebe: Oh, I'm not gonna do this, okay? I'm not gonna eavesdrop   on my friend.
Rachel: (through wall) Ooh... I love Barbados!  
(Phoebe starts to listen at the other wall, where Rachel's room is. There,   Joey and Rachel are kissing.)
Joey: Ooh... I can't believe I'm kissing you. I'm  kissing Rachel!
Rachel: I know, I'm her!
(they start to kiss again, and Phoebe turns to Chandler and Monica)
Phoebe: (whispering) Rachel and Joey! It's Rachel and Joey!!!
Monica: What?
Phoebe: Get over here!
(Chandler and Monica take a sprint to the other wall)
Rachel: ooh...
Chandler: Wow!
Monica: (in her Monica-excited-way... TOO LOUD!) Oh my God,   I love how thin these walls are!
(In the rooms next door, Joey, Rachel, Ross and Charlie stop kissing and try   to understand what the yelling was about. After a while they continue kissing.   We're back in Chandler and Monica's room. Monica has some of her own hair   stuffed in her mouth by Chandler.)
Monica: (muffled) Thank you.
OPENING CREDITS
(Rachel and Joey's)
Rachel: Hey, you know, before you said  that nothing could happen between us? What changed?
Joey: Well, I only said that because of Ross, you know. Then   I saw him kissing Charlie...
Rachel: What? Ross and Charlie? (Joey nods) Wow! She's really   making her way through the group, huh? Ah, who am I to talk?
(Chandler and Monica's)
Monica: I can't believe this. Rachel and Joey?
Chandler: How about the dinosaur twins in the other room?   No-one is manning that wall!
Monica: I'm on it!
Chandler: Anything?
Monica: I think I hear curtains closing... 
Phoebe: We've got shoes being kicked off over here.
Monica: Bedsprings, unmistakable!
Chandler: You do realise  that's your brother?
Monica: Not until you said it. Somebody switch! (Chandler   makes a clicking sound with his fingers and Phoebe runs to the other wall.   Monica returns to Chandlers wall.) Wait a minute... Ross and Charlie, Joey   and Rachel, Phoebe and Mike! We're the only people  leaving with the   same person we came with.
Chandler: That's not true. I came with Monica and I'm leaving   with Weird Al.
Monica: Okay, I've had it with the hair jokes. Tomorrow morning,   before we leave, I'm going to the salon.
Chandler: Okay Buckwheat!
Phoebe: You gotta hear this, it's great... It's like free   porn! (Chandler eagerly rushes over)
(Ross and Charlie's)
Ross: Weh...*sigh*
Charlie: uhm... Is everything okay?
Ross: Yeah, It's just... I don't think I can do this...
Charlie: Ooh... Is it because of what might be on the bedspread,   because I saw that news report too, with the infra red and the ... I could   just...
Ross: No, NO! (they're moving to the side of the bed, where   they sit down) Look, I need to talk to Joey. I mean, you guys just broke up.   Before anything more happens between us, I need to know he's okay with it.
Charlie: I uhm... I completely understand.
Ross: Alright, I'm gonna go find them... (twitches a bit,   looks down) I just need a... need a before I can... you know. (gestures standing   up... they sit and wait for a while) Grandma... grandma... grandma... (he tries   to concentrate...) Okay, I see you later.
Charlie: Okay...
(Chandler and Monica's, all three of them are listening at the wall to   Ross and Charlie's)
Phoebe: That's the door. He's gone...
Chandler: And she's... turning on the TV... and watching...   Miss Congeniality!
Monica: Honey, if you know it through a wall, you know it   too well!
(They are still listening at the wall, when Ross enters their room)
Ross: Hey, what are you guys doing?
Phoebe: Oh, we're just... we're sad to go so we're just saying   goodbye to the hotel. (hugs the wall) I love you... Paradise Hotel, Golf resort   and Spa... (she walks away from the wall)
Monica: (also hugs the wall) Yeah, we had a great time, thank   you! (walks to Phoebe)
Chandler: (caresses the wall with his finger) Bye!
Ross: Okay, uhm... Hey, you guys seen Joey anywhere?
Chandler: He's probably in his room with his current girlfriend   Charlie. That's the situation as we know it... (walks to Phoebe and Monica)
Ross: Well, if you see him could you please tell   him I'm looking for him?
Chandler: You got it!
Ross: Thanks! (walks out of the room and starts hugging the   wall) Thank you! (closes the door)
Monica: Other wall, people! Other wall!
(they rush to the wall to Rachel and Joey's, and we move to that room)
Ross: (knocks on door) Rach,  you there? (Joey and Rachel   both get up from the bed)
Joey: Oh my God, it's Ross. What are we gonna do?
Rachel: Oh, ju-ju-just stay calm. Just be calm. For all he   knows we're just hanging out together. Right? Just be nonchalant. (Joey like   stands at attention with his chest forward and his hands on his sides, looking   up at the ceiling with his lips pouted.) That's not nonchalant!
Joey: No idea what it means.
Rachel: Oh... okay, just hide!
Ross: (knocks) Rach?
Rachel: Coming! Try under the bed, try under the bed!
(When Rachel  starts to look under the bed if Joey would fit under there, Chandler opens   the door inbetween the rooms, grabs Joey by his shirt and drags him to his room, and closes the door again)
Rachel: There's no room under the bed. (looks around because   she can't find Joey anymore)
Ross: Is everything okay?
Rachel: Yeah... (still looking to see where Joey went, and   opens the door)
Ross: Hey.
Rachel: Hi...
Ross: You know where Joey is?
Rachel: ...I really don't... (looks around again)
Ross: Can I talk to you for a minute?
Rachel: Yeah, sure... (looks outside into the corridor if   Joey is there)
(Monica and Chandler's room. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler have their ears pressed   against the wall, and Joey looks at them)
Joey: I don't believe this... Have you guys been...
Phoebe: Shhh... This is the listening side of the   wall.
(Now Joey also wants to listen, and wants to press his ears against the door,   which has a big mirror on it, he hesitates seeing himself in the mirror, but   still puts his ear against it. We move again to Rachel's room.)
Ross: And then she told me that she and Joey had broken up,   and that part of the reason was that she had feelings for me.
Rachel: (clearly not listening and still trying to find out   where Joey went) Uh-huh... right... yeah...
Ross: And you know I wanted to ask Charlie out since the   day I met her.
Rachel: (still searching) Oh, I know... I know it's been   really hard for you.
Ross: Anyway, one thing lead to another, and... oh... before   you know it, we were kissing. I mean, how angry do you think Joey is gonna   be?
Rachel: (now looking up at the ceiling) That is hard to say,   Ross. That is hard to say.
Ross: You know, I gotta go find him. He's gotta be here someplace.
Rachel: You would think!
(Ross leaves the room)
Rachel: Joey!
Joey: Is he gone?
Rachel: (still can't find him) How are you doing this?
(Joey now enters the room through the door, Monica, Chandler and Phoebe are   following him.)
Joey: Pssst...
Rachel: How... wha... Hey! What are you... What is this?   Have you guys been listening this entire time?
Monica, Chandler and Phoebe: YE-AH!
Phoebe: Now, what is this?
Rachel: Ah, what is this? Well, lets see, we kissed for ten   minutes and now we're talking to our friends about it, so I guess this is sixth   grade!
Phoebe: Oh no... Have you thought about it how complicated   this could get? What about Ross?
Joey: Well, he's with Charlie now.
Monica: Yeah, but he wants to talk to you before anything   really happens with her. And as his friend, I mean, don't you think   he deserves the same from you?
Joey: (long pause and he twitches a bit) You're a pain in   my ass, Geller!
Rachel: All right, look you guys... Look, we appreciate all   the advice, but this is between Joey and me and I think we can handle it...
Chandler: Okay, well we'll go back in there, but will you   do one thing for us? The people that  care about you?
Rachel: Sure...
Chandler: Enunciate!
Rachel: Get out!
(They leave and Rachel locks the door.)
Rachel: Are they right?
Joey: Probably, yeah... I mean, maybe we should... hold off   until we talk to Ross.
Rachel: Yeah... Yeah, we can wait, we don't have   to do anything tonight.
Joey: Yeah, I think that'd be best... So, so I'm gonna...   I'm gonna take off...
Rachel: (Joey walks to the door) Although... 
Joey: (turns around very fast) I like although!
Rachel: I mean, you know... Ross and I haven't dated in like...   six years...
Joey: Six years? Wow... It's almost as long as highschool...
Rachel: Plus, you know, he is with Charlie now.
Joey: Absolutely! He's not thinking about you.
Rachel: No...
Joey: I'm thinking about you...
Rachel: Yeah...
Joey: Let's forget about Ross...
Rachel: Forgotten.
(They want to kiss, but just before their lips touch, Rachel pulls back quickly,   gasping)
Joey: What's wrong?
Rachel: Nothing...
Joey's voice, but she sees Ross: Seriously... What is it?
Rachel: Nothing... It's really... It's nothing... Come here,   come here...
(again, just before their lips touch, she pulls back, gasping)
Joey's voice/Ross: What's wrong?
Rachel: Sorry, I just uhm... I can't seem to get Ross out   of my head...
Joey: Well, maybe I can help. (he grabs her head passionately,   closes his eyes and kisses... Ross in Rachel's dress! He realises it too late,   and when he does, pushes Ross's/Rachel's head away)
Rachel/Ross: Ooh, your lips are so soft... Do   that again... (and she/he moves in for another kiss. Joey, pushes her head   away again...)
Joey: Yeah... we really need to talk to Ross...
Both: Yeah
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's room. Chandler is packing when Ross knocks on   the door and enters...]
Ross: Hey!
Chandler: Hey!
Ross: You guys ready to go?
Chandler: Not quite. Monica's still at the salon, and I'm   just finishing packing.
Ross: Dude! You're not taking your Bible?
Chandler: You're not supposed to take that. Besides, it's   a New Testament, what are you gonna do with it?
Ross: Learn about Jesus...
(Charlie now also enters the room, Chandler walks to the bathroom)
Ross: Hey!
Charlie: So, did you talk to Joey?
Ross: Uh, no... no. I couldn't find him. I'm just gonna talk   to him on the plane.
Charlie: Yeah, sounds like a good idea... Dr. Geller!
Ross: Stop it!
Charlie: PHD
Ross: You're filthy!
(Phoebe enters)
Phoebe: Hey, have you guys seen Monica?
Ross: Uh, actually I think she went to the salon.
Phoebe: Oh yeah, oh, she went to the salon alright...
(Monica enters, with her hair braided and little shells at the end)
Monica: Check it out!
Phoebe: Who's day just got better? CHANDLER!
(Chandler enters from the bathroom)
Chandler: Hey!... aaaaaahhhh!
Monica: What do you think?
Chandler: I think.... I think I can see your scalp.
Monica: Don't you just love it?
Ross: Ye... Yeah... Yeah... You got shellfish in your head.
Charlie: It's so... something... You go girlfriend!
Ross: You've never said that in your life, have you?
Charlie: Not once.
Ross: I thought so.
Monica: And listen to this... (shakes her body so the shells   tingle)
Chandler: What d'ya know... It's a treat for the eyes and the   ears.
[Scene: Boarding the plane.]
Joey: Whoo, whoo. Wow, it's uhm... kinda weird that I'm sitting   next to Charlie after we broke up.
Chandler: Yeah, it's almost if Air Barbados doesn't care   about your social life.
Joey: Look, does someone mind switching to sit with Charlie?
Ross: Oh, I uh, I mean, I... dude, I spent the whole conference   with Charlie.
Joey: I understand...
Ross: No, I'll do it. (he quickly grabs Joey's boarding pass   and gives Joey his one.)
Chandler: Wish I could switch with someone. I really don't   wanna sit with Allen Iverson over there.
(Switch to Phoebe and Mike, who are kissing)
Phoebe: Uhm... You know, once we're in the air and the captain   turns off the seatbelt sign... you feel free to roam about my cabin...
Mike: You should be careful when checking your overhead bins,   'cause items may shift during...
Phoebe: Aaah... you're not good at this...
Mike: You don't have to go home tonight, do you?
Phoebe: No, I think I can come over. It's Saturday, right?
Mike: Oh...
Phoebe: What?
Mike: Uhm... I can't do anything tonight.
Phoebe: Why not?
Mike: I have a date.
Phoebe: You have a... You have a date? With who?
Mike: Oh, it's... my girlfriend.
Phoebe: (lets go of his hand) You have...  have a girlfriend?
Mike: Yeah... Well, when... you and I broke up I started   seeing someone.
Phoebe: For how long?
Mike: Three months.
Phoebe: Three months? Okay... This is probably none of my   business, but uhm, how long do you think you're gonna keep seeing her?
Mike: I'll tell her that it's over tonight at dinner. I   promise.
Phoebe: Oh, okay... good. You do that. And then when you   get home, maybe there'll be a special delivery package waiting for you.
Mike: Maybe I'll sign for it. Tear it open. Pull out the   packing material...
Phoebe: You know what, we're gonna have sex. Let's just leave   it there.
(cut to Charlie and Ross)
Ross: Right, I'm gonna go talk to Joey. I think this is the   right time. He's always in a good mood after the flight attendant says "duty   free".
Charlie: Okay... Good luck.
(Ross gets up and gestures to Rachel, we cut to Joey and Rachel)
Rachel: Ross is coming over. I think now would be a really   good time to talk to him.
Joey: I guess so. I'm just... really nervous.
Rachel: Okay, well keep in mind that by the time you're done,   they'll probably be serving dinner.
Joey: Ooh...
Rachel: Still nervous?
Joey: I'm gonna get the lasagna.
Ross: Hey Rach...
Rachel: Yeah!
Ross: Do you mind if I sit here for a sec.?
Rachel: Yeah, yeah sure! Yeah! (mouths "Good luck" to   Joey and gets up from her seat)
Ross: Hey!
Joey: Hey!
Ross: So, I uhm... kinda need to talk to you about Charlie.
Joey: Yeah?
Ross: Okay, last night after you guys broke up... so sorry   to hear about that, by the way... Well, Charlie and I were talking, and...,   well...
Joey: You kissed.
Ross: Wha... (gasps) What? What would give you that idea?
Joey: I saw you.
Ross: Yeah, we kissed, but... nothing else... nothing else   happened, okay.
Joey: Ross, Ross, Ross... It's okay.
Ross: What?
Joey: It's okay. You know, I totally understand,   alright? You guys, make way more sense than her and I ever did, you know. And...   I want you to be happy.
Ross: Are you serious?
Joey: Yeah... Now I have something...
Ross: I am speachless... I mean the fact that you would put   my happiness first like that. I mean, you're an incredible friend, you know   that?
Joey: Oh... uh...  look... before you...
Ross: No, I mean it. You are so loyal man, and selfless,   and generous...
Joey: I am those things, yeah.
Ross: You know what? I know Chandler longer, so I always   think of him as my best friend, but now... I may have to rethink some   stuff...
Joey: Dude!
Ross: Hey, if there is ever, anything I can do for you...
Joey: I can't think of anything.
(They both hug, and Rachel, who was in the back of the plane, sees this and   smiles.)
Ross: Thanks!
Joey: Yeah.
(Ross walks to the back of the plane, where Rachel is.)
Rachel: So hi!
Ross: Hi!
Rachel: So you eh, you talked to Joey?
Ross: Ah, yeah. We had a really good talk.
Rachel: Oh! That's great!
Ross: Yeah!
Rachel: Oh, so everything's okay?
Ross: Oh, no, it's great. It's great. He is... He is an amazing   guy.
Rachel: Ah... Well, obviously I think so too.
Ross: Well, I'm so excited about this.
Rachel: Really? Excited?
Ross: Are you kidding? I have had some very dirty dreams   about this...
Rachel: Excuse me! (and she walks back to Joey, who is still   looking very impressed about what Ross said to him. Rachel looks at him and   hits him.) You didn't tell him, did you?
Joey: I couldn't. He was saying all these really nice things   about me. I didn't want him to get mad and take 'em all back. I'm on a edge   on Chandler.
Rachel: Oh God! Alright, fine. You know what Joey, forget   it. When we go back to New York, I will tell him.
Joey: Thank you. Yeah, I appreciate that.
(Chandler walks by and Joey lets out an evil "muhahaho".)
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Mike's apartment. Phoebe's there and the phone rings.]
Phoebe: Hi, Mike's place.
Mike: Hey, it's Mike.
Phoebe: Ooh, that was fast.
Mike: Oh, err... no, she's not here yet. You know, I think   I'm just gonna take off and break up with her over the phone...
Phoebe: Yeah, you can't do that! Oh, come on Mike, strap   on a pair.Why don't you just tell her that we got back together. You know,   women appreciate honesty. We also appreciate gentle spanking once in a while.   Just F.Y.I.
Mike: One more thing... There... might be a picture of Precious   on my coffee table.
Phoebe: Her name is Precious? Is she a purebreed or did you   pick her up at the pound?
Mike: Anyway, I just wanna give you a heads up. 
Phoebe: Okay, oh and you know, if she gets upset, just scratch   her tummy and give her a liver snout. (laughs and hangs up the phone)
(there's knocking on the door which Phoebe opens)
Precious: Hi, I'm Precious, who are you?
Phoebe: (stunned) I... I'm Phoebe.
Precious: Phoebe? Mike's ex-girlfriend Phoebe, the love of   his life? That Phoebe?
Phoebe: Enchant (she holds out her hand, and they shake   hands)
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Monica's carrying the laundry hamper   to their coffee table.]
Monica: Oh, I can't wait for everyone at work to see these...   (plays with her hair to make the shells tingle again) Ow!
Chandler: You go back to work tomorrow night, right?
Monica: Yeah!
Chandler: So if you want people to see them, then by definition   you're not  having them taken out... say, at the break of dawn?
Monica: Well, if I had them taken out, then I wouldn't be   able to do this. (she pushes Chandler on the couch and brushes her   hair and shells against Chandler's chest) You like that, right? (again, she   brushes her hair against his chest and hums...)
Chandler: What are you singing?
Monica: It's "Bolero" from "10".
Chandler: It's "Ride of the Valkyries" from "Apocalypse   Now"...   See, here's the thing: The corn rose were really a solution to your frizzy   hair problem. And now that we're home, we don't have that problem anymore,   so if you think about it... I hate them!
Monica: You what? You said you liked them.
Chandler: Did I? Let's refresh. I believe what I said was   that I could see your scalp.
Monica: Fine, so you don't like them. Everybody else does.
Chandler: Again, let's journey back... As I recall what Rachel   said, was  she had never notice the shape of your skull before. And Joey...   Well, Joey didn't realise that there was anything different.
Monica: You know what? I don't care. I like it like this,   and I'm gonna keep it. You're just jealous because your hair can't do this...   (and she shakes her head more violently) OUCH!
Chandler: Hit yourself in the tooth?
Monica: And the eye!
[Scene: Ross's apartment.Someone's knocking on the door. Ross rushes to the   door and it's Rachel with Emma.]
Ross: (gasps) Hi... There she is. Hi Emma. Oh my God, I missed   you. (kisses her) Oh Emma, I missed you so much. Hey... Did you have   a good time with grandma Green? Huh? Did she give you a bottle of anti-depressants   again to use as a rattle? (to Rachel)
Rachel: That was one time, Ross, and they were only like   5 milligrams.
Ross: Ooh hey, Emma, daddy has some presents for you okay?   Okay? I want you to wait right here. Come here sweetie.
Rachel: Aaah... Ross, actually there's something that I really   need to talk to you about.
Ross: (unpacking his bag) Okay, shoot!
Rachel: Okay, uhm... alright, here's the deal.
Ross: (gasps) OH NO!
Rachel: What? What is it?
Ross: Oh, major shampoo explosion!
Rachel: Uh, look Ross, this really isn't easy.
Ross: Oh, it's all over everything. Why?   Why me? (looks up)
Rachel: Because you took three hundred bottles of shampoo?
Ross: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You were saying?
Rachel: Well, yeah... Okay, look it's about me and...
Ross: Oh, not another one! Oh my G... And this is moisturiser.   It's even harder to clean! Why? Why do bad things happen to good people?
Rachel: Wow! Well, clearly this is not a good time.
Ross: Duh, you think? (enters the kitchen)
[Scene: Mike's place. Phoebe is on the phone.]
Phoebe: Okay, bye. Alright, so Mike's on his way over. See,   you thought you guys were meeting here, and he thought you were meeting at   the restaurant, so you know... Doesn't really matter who's right or wrong.   Point is... I'm gonna take off.
Precious: I'm not letting you leave until you tell me what's   going on here. I mean, are you guys getting back together or something?
Phoebe: Alright... Susie, can I call you Susie?
Precious: My name is Precious.
Phoebe: Yeah, I can't say that. uhm... Susie, I'm gonna be   straight with you... Mike and I are back together... and uhm... unfortunately   that effectively ends your relationship with him. And he's very sorry about   that and wishes you the best of luck in all your endeavours.
Precious: I just can't believe this... Why?
Phoebe: Well, I don't...
Precious: Oh, why would he do this? I mean, what's wrong   with me?
Phoebe: Nothing, there's nothing wrong with you.
Precious: I mean, what the hell am I supposed to do now?
Phoebe: Damn it woman, pull yourself together! Have  some pride, for the love of God.
(Precious starts crying)
Phoebe: Okay, not a fan of the tough love.
Precious: I just can't believe that Mike didn't give me any   warning.
Phoebe: But he didn't really know, you know. He wasn't planning   on coming to Barbados and proposing to me...
Precious: He proposed to you? This is the worst birthday  ever.   (she starts to cry again)
Phoebe: Look, Precious... Mike's not worth this.   You're an attractive, intelligent woman and let's face it, Mike's kind of a   wang. I mean, he proposed to me while he was still seeing you... He was gonna   break-up with you on your birthday? And, I don't like to kiss-and-tell,   but he cheated on you a lot this weekend.
Precious: Oh, my God, maybe you're right. Maybe I don't need   him. I deserve to be treated with respect.
(Mike enters the apartment.)
Precious: Screw you, Mike. You're a coward and a bastard,   and I hope you rot in hell. 
(she slaps him in the face, Mike looks like he  doesn't believe what just happened. Precious leaves, and he turns to Phoebe.)
Phoebe: You're welcome!
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's. Only Chandler is in the living room and walks   to the bathroom.]
Chandler: Honey, you've been in there for a long time...   Is everything okay?
Monica: Not really. 
(Chandler enters the bathroom, and Monica is standing there in a towel, with   her hair stuck in the shower curtain.)
Monica: I have a problem.
Chandler: Really? What happened?
Monica: Well, I was dancing around, and singing "No Woman,   No Cry" and I got stuck.
Chandler: You can't move at all?
Monica: Oh, well, I can move... (she moves back and forth   the shower curtain rail, opening and closing the shower curtain with her hair   as she goes)
Chandler: If I untangle you, will you please get rid of the corn rose?
Monica: (looking disappointed) I guess so...
Chandler: (trying to untangle her) Some of these look a little   frayed.
Monica: Yeah, I tried to gnaw myself free.
[Scene: Rachel and Joey's apartment. Joey enters.]
Joey: Hey!
Rachel: Hi!
Joey: So, did you err... did you tell Ross?
Rachel: Well, I tried, but then he had a shampoo related   emergency. So I guess now it's your turn again.
Joey: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no... I think it's better   if you tell him, you know. It's easier for a woman. That way, you know, if   he gets mad, all you have to do is go... I didn't mean it. I'm so so--ooory. (he   pushes  his breasts together from the side)
Rachel: Yeah, 'cause that's what we do.
Joey: Alright, alright, okay, uhm... How 'bout this, how   about this? Tomorrow... tomorrow we'll both go and we'll tell him together.
Rachel: Okay, that sounds fair. It just means that once again   we can't...
Joey: I know, I know..., but that's okay. I mean, we can   control ourselves, we're not animals.
Rachel: No! Of course we can wait. Alright, so I guess that   means good night then?
Joey: Yeah! Good night! (they give each other a small kiss   on the mouth, and stare at each other for a while)
Rachel: Goo--ood night!
Joey: Good night! (they give each other a kiss again, but   this time it lasts longer)
Rachel: Seriously, good night!
Joey: Stop saying good night.
Rachel: Okay.
(Now they kiss passionately... and then Ross enters with Emma. They freeze,   pull away and look at Ross who looks like he just can't believe what he's seeing.   Joey straightens his shirt, and Rachel says I'm so-oo sorry, and   presses her breasts together, just like Joey did before.)
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Monica and Chandler's. Monica walks in with one of those knitted Rasta   hats.]
Monica: Look what I found in the drawer... (Chandler looks   up from his book.) And you said I'd never wear this...
Chandler: Now that I untangled you, how 'bout you doing a   little something for me?
Monica: Sure, what do you have in mind?
Chandler: I think you know.
Monica: Really? I don't really feel like it.
Chandler: This is what I want to do.
Monica: Okay, I just don't get why you like it so much.
Chandler: (Picks up the "Miss Congeniality" DVD) She's an   FBI agent, posing as a beauty contestant.
THE END

lines.text: [Scene: Barbados, Monica and Chandler's Room. They both enter from Ross's   room. Monica still has her big, frizzy hair.]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, the way you crushed Mike at ping pong was such   a turn-on.You wanna...? (plays with her finger on Chandlers chest)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You know, I'd love to, but I'm a little tired.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'll put a pillowcase over my head.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You're on!
(they start to get ready, but then Phoebe enters through the door from Ross's   room)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What's up?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, okay, Mike's taking a shower, which by the   way there's  no law against. And then we're gonna grab some food, so if you   want...
(there's a door slamming in Ross's room, and some indistinct murmuring)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: ... finally...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Is that Ross?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, you can hear everything through these stupid   walls.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Sounds like he's with someone.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: He could be alone. This morning I heard him do   push-ups, and then talk to his triceps.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Wait a minute, I think Phoebe's right. You know I   hear someone else in there with him.
(they all put their ear against the wall to be able to hear what's   being said. We move to Ross's room where he and Charlie are kissing.)

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Ooh... Dr. Geller!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: God, you're amazing... I didn't even have to ask you   to call me that.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh my God, that's Charlie!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: She's cheating on Joey with Ross!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh that tart... floozy... giant...

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm not sure about this.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, you're right. This is none of our business.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: No I'm not sure that it's  the best way to hear   everything. Someone get me a glass!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, I'm not gonna do this, okay? I'm not gonna eavesdrop   on my friend.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (through wall) Ooh... I love Barbados!
(Phoebe starts to listen at the other wall, where Rachel's room is. There,   Joey and Rachel are kissing.)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ooh... I can't believe I'm kissing you. I'm  kissing Rachel!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I know, I'm her!
(they start to kiss again, and Phoebe turns to Chandler and Monica)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (whispering) Rachel and Joey! It's Rachel and Joey!!!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Get over here!
(Chandler and Monica take a sprint to the other wall)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: ooh...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Wow!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (in her Monica-excited-way... TOO LOUD!) Oh my God,   I love how thin these walls are!

(In the rooms next door, Joey, Rachel, Ross and Charlie stop kissing and try   to understand what the yelling was about. After a while they continue kissing.   We're back in Chandler and Monica's room. Monica has some of her own hair   stuffed in her mouth by Chandler.)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (muffled) Thank you.
OPENING CREDITS
(Rachel and Joey's)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hey, you know, before you said  that nothing could happen between us? What changed?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Well, I only said that because of Ross, you know. Then   I saw him kissing Charlie...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What? Ross and Charlie? (Joey nods) Wow! She's really   making her way through the group, huh? Ah, who am I to talk?
(Chandler and Monica's)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I can't believe this. Rachel and Joey?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: How about the dinosaur twins in the other room?   No-one is manning that wall!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I'm on it!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Anything?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I think I hear curtains closing...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: We've got shoes being kicked off over here.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Bedsprings, unmistakable!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You do realise  that's your brother?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Not until you said it. Somebody switch! (Chandler   makes a clicking sound with his fingers and Phoebe runs to the other wall.   Monica returns to Chandlers wall.) Wait a minute... Ross and Charlie, Joey   and Rachel, Phoebe and Mike! We're the only people  leaving with the   same person we came with.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: That's not true. I came with Monica and I'm leaving   with Weird Al.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Okay, I've had it with the hair jokes. Tomorrow morning,   before we leave, I'm going to the salon.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Okay Buckwheat!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You gotta hear this, it's great... It's like free   porn! (Chandler eagerly rushes over)
(Ross and Charlie's)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Weh...*sigh*

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: uhm... Is everything okay?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, It's just... I don't think I can do this...

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Ooh... Is it because of what might be on the bedspread,   because I saw that news report too, with the infra red and the ... I could   just...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, NO! (they're moving to the side of the bed, where   they sit down) Look, I need to talk to Joey. I mean, you guys just broke up.   Before anything more happens between us, I need to know he's okay with it.

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: I uhm... I completely understand.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Alright, I'm gonna go find them... (twitches a bit,   looks down) I just need a... need a before I can... you know. (gestures standing   up... they sit and wait for a while) Grandma... grandma... grandma... (he tries   to concentrate...) Okay, I see you later.

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Okay...
(Chandler and Monica's, all three of them are listening at the wall to   Ross and Charlie's)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: That's the door. He's gone...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: And she's... turning on the TV... and watching...   Miss Congeniality!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Honey, if you know it through a wall, you know it   too well!
(They are still listening at the wall, when Ross enters their room)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey, what are you guys doing?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, we're just... we're sad to go so we're just saying   goodbye to the hotel. (hugs the wall) I love you... Paradise Hotel, Golf resort   and Spa... (she walks away from the wall)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (also hugs the wall) Yeah, we had a great time, thank   you! (walks to Phoebe)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (caresses the wall with his finger) Bye!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Okay, uhm... Hey, you guys seen Joey anywhere?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: He's probably in his room with his current girlfriend   Charlie. That's the situation as we know it... (walks to Phoebe and Monica)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, if you see him could you please tell   him I'm looking for him?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You got it!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Thanks! (walks out of the room and starts hugging the   wall) Thank you! (closes the door)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Other wall, people! Other wall!
(they rush to the wall to Rachel and Joey's, and we move to that room)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (knocks on door) Rach,  you there? (Joey and Rachel   both get up from the bed)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh my God, it's Ross. What are we gonna do?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, ju-ju-just stay calm. Just be calm. For all he   knows we're just hanging out together. Right? Just be nonchalant. (Joey like   stands at attention with his chest forward and his hands on his sides, looking   up at the ceiling with his lips pouted.) That's not nonchalant!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: No idea what it means.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh... okay, just hide!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (knocks) Rach?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Coming! Try under the bed, try under the bed!
(When Rachel  starts to look under the bed if Joey would fit under there, Chandler opens   the door inbetween the rooms, grabs Joey by his shirt and drags him to his room, and closes the door again)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: There's no room under the bed. (looks around because   she can't find Joey anymore)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Is everything okay?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah... (still looking to see where Joey went, and   opens the door)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know where Joey is?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: ...I really don't... (looks around again)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Can I talk to you for a minute?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah, sure... (looks outside into the corridor if   Joey is there)
(Monica and Chandler's room. Phoebe, Monica and Chandler have their ears pressed   against the wall, and Joey looks at them)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I don't believe this... Have you guys been...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Shhh... This is the listening side of the   wall.

(Now Joey also wants to listen, and wants to press his ears against the door,   which has a big mirror on it, he hesitates seeing himself in the mirror, but   still puts his ear against it. We move again to Rachel's room.)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: And then she told me that she and Joey had broken up,   and that part of the reason was that she had feelings for me.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (clearly not listening and still trying to find out   where Joey went) Uh-huh... right... yeah...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: And you know I wanted to ask Charlie out since the   day I met her.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (still searching) Oh, I know... I know it's been   really hard for you.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Anyway, one thing lead to another, and... oh... before   you know it, we were kissing. I mean, how angry do you think Joey is gonna   be?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (now looking up at the ceiling) That is hard to say,   Ross. That is hard to say.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know, I gotta go find him. He's gotta be here someplace.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: You would think!
(Ross leaves the room)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Joey!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Is he gone?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (still can't find him) How are you doing this?
(Joey now enters the room through the door, Monica, Chandler and Phoebe are   following him.)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Pssst...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: How... wha... Hey! What are you... What is this?   Have you guys been listening this entire time?
Monica, Chandler and Phoebe: YE-AH!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Now, what is this?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ah, what is this? Well, lets see, we kissed for ten   minutes and now we're talking to our friends about it, so I guess this is sixth   grade!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh no... Have you thought about it how complicated   this could get? What about Ross?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Well, he's with Charlie now.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, but he wants to talk to you before anything   really happens with her. And as his friend, I mean, don't you think   he deserves the same from you?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (long pause and he twitches a bit) You're a pain in   my ass, Geller!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: All right, look you guys... Look, we appreciate all   the advice, but this is between Joey and me and I think we can handle it...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Okay, well we'll go back in there, but will you   do one thing for us? The people that  care about you?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Sure...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Enunciate!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Get out!
(They leave and Rachel locks the door.)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Are they right?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Probably, yeah... I mean, maybe we should... hold off   until we talk to Ross.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah... Yeah, we can wait, we don't have   to do anything tonight.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah, I think that'd be best... So, so I'm gonna...   I'm gonna take off...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: (Joey walks to the door) Although...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: (turns around very fast) I like although!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: I mean, you know... Ross and I haven't dated in like...   six years...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Six years? Wow... It's almost as long as highschool...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Plus, you know, he is with Charlie now.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Absolutely! He's not thinking about you.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I'm thinking about you...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Let's forget about Ross...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Forgotten.
(They want to kiss, but just before their lips touch, Rachel pulls back quickly,   gasping)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: What's wrong?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Nothing...
Joey's voice, but she sees Ross: Seriously... What is it?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Nothing... It's really... It's nothing... Come here,   come here...
(again, just before their lips touch, she pulls back, gasping)
Joey's voice/Ross: What's wrong?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Sorry, I just uhm... I can't seem to get Ross out   of my head...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Well, maybe I can help. (he grabs her head passionately,   closes his eyes and kisses... Ross in Rachel's dress! He realises it too late,   and when he does, pushes Ross's/Rachel's head away)
Rachel/Ross: Ooh, your lips are so soft... Do   that again... (and she/he moves in for another kiss. Joey, pushes her head   away again...)

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah... we really need to talk to Ross...

lines.speaker: Both
lines.text: Yeah
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's room. Chandler is packing when Ross knocks on   the door and enters...]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You guys ready to go?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Not quite. Monica's still at the salon, and I'm   just finishing packing.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Dude! You're not taking your Bible?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You're not supposed to take that. Besides, it's   a New Testament, what are you gonna do with it?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Learn about Jesus...
(Charlie now also enters the room, Chandler walks to the bathroom)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: So, did you talk to Joey?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh, no... no. I couldn't find him. I'm just gonna talk   to him on the plane.

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Yeah, sounds like a good idea... Dr. Geller!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Stop it!

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: PHD

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You're filthy!
(Phoebe enters)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hey, have you guys seen Monica?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Uh, actually I think she went to the salon.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh yeah, oh, she went to the salon alright...
(Monica enters, with her hair braided and little shells at the end)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Check it out!

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Who's day just got better? CHANDLER!
(Chandler enters from the bathroom)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hey!... aaaaaahhhh!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: What do you think?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I think.... I think I can see your scalp.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Don't you just love it?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ye... Yeah... Yeah... You got shellfish in your head.

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: It's so... something... You go girlfriend!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You've never said that in your life, have you?

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Not once.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I thought so.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: And listen to this... (shakes her body so the shells   tingle)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What d'ya know... It's a treat for the eyes and the   ears.
[Scene: Boarding the plane.]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Whoo, whoo. Wow, it's uhm... kinda weird that I'm sitting   next to Charlie after we broke up.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Yeah, it's almost if Air Barbados doesn't care   about your social life.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Look, does someone mind switching to sit with Charlie?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, I uh, I mean, I... dude, I spent the whole conference   with Charlie.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I understand...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, I'll do it. (he quickly grabs Joey's boarding pass   and gives Joey his one.)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Wish I could switch with someone. I really don't   wanna sit with Allen Iverson over there.
(Switch to Phoebe and Mike, who are kissing)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Uhm... You know, once we're in the air and the captain   turns off the seatbelt sign... you feel free to roam about my cabin...

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: You should be careful when checking your overhead bins,   'cause items may shift during...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Aaah... you're not good at this...

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: You don't have to go home tonight, do you?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: No, I think I can come over. It's Saturday, right?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Oh...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Uhm... I can't do anything tonight.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Why not?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I have a date.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You have a... You have a date? With who?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Oh, it's... my girlfriend.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (lets go of his hand) You have...  have a girlfriend?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Yeah... Well, when... you and I broke up I started   seeing someone.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: For how long?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Three months.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Three months? Okay... This is probably none of my   business, but uhm, how long do you think you're gonna keep seeing her?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: I'll tell her that it's over tonight at dinner. I   promise.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Oh, okay... good. You do that. And then when you   get home, maybe there'll be a special delivery package waiting for you.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Maybe I'll sign for it. Tear it open. Pull out the   packing material...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You know what, we're gonna have sex. Let's just leave   it there.
(cut to Charlie and Ross)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Right, I'm gonna go talk to Joey. I think this is the   right time. He's always in a good mood after the flight attendant says "duty   free".

lines.speaker: Charlie
lines.text: Okay... Good luck.
(Ross gets up and gestures to Rachel, we cut to Joey and Rachel)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ross is coming over. I think now would be a really   good time to talk to him.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I guess so. I'm just... really nervous.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay, well keep in mind that by the time you're done,   they'll probably be serving dinner.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ooh...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Still nervous?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I'm gonna get the lasagna.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey Rach...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Do you mind if I sit here for a sec.?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah, yeah sure! Yeah! (mouths "Good luck" to   Joey and gets up from her seat)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: So, I uhm... kinda need to talk to you about Charlie.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Okay, last night after you guys broke up... so sorry   to hear about that, by the way... Well, Charlie and I were talking, and...,   well...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: You kissed.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Wha... (gasps) What? What would give you that idea?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I saw you.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah, we kissed, but... nothing else... nothing else   happened, okay.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Ross, Ross, Ross... It's okay.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: What?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: It's okay. You know, I totally understand,   alright? You guys, make way more sense than her and I ever did, you know. And...   I want you to be happy.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Are you serious?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah... Now I have something...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I am speachless... I mean the fact that you would put   my happiness first like that. I mean, you're an incredible friend, you know   that?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Oh... uh...  look... before you...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: No, I mean it. You are so loyal man, and selfless,   and generous...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I am those things, yeah.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: You know what? I know Chandler longer, so I always   think of him as my best friend, but now... I may have to rethink some   stuff...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Dude!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hey, if there is ever, anything I can do for you...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I can't think of anything.
(They both hug, and Rachel, who was in the back of the plane, sees this and   smiles.)

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Thanks!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah.
(Ross walks to the back of the plane, where Rachel is.)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So hi!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: So you eh, you talked to Joey?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ah, yeah. We had a really good talk.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh! That's great!

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh, so everything's okay?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, no, it's great. It's great. He is... He is an amazing   guy.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Ah... Well, obviously I think so too.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Well, I'm so excited about this.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Really? Excited?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Are you kidding? I have had some very dirty dreams   about this...

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Excuse me! (and she walks back to Joey, who is still   looking very impressed about what Ross said to him. Rachel looks at him and   hits him.) You didn't tell him, did you?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I couldn't. He was saying all these really nice things   about me. I didn't want him to get mad and take 'em all back. I'm on a edge   on Chandler.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Oh God! Alright, fine. You know what Joey, forget   it. When we go back to New York, I will tell him.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Thank you. Yeah, I appreciate that.
(Chandler walks by and Joey lets out an evil "muhahaho".)
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Mike's apartment. Phoebe's there and the phone rings.]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Hi, Mike's place.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Hey, it's Mike.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Ooh, that was fast.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Oh, err... no, she's not here yet. You know, I think   I'm just gonna take off and break up with her over the phone...

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, you can't do that! Oh, come on Mike, strap   on a pair.Why don't you just tell her that we got back together. You know,   women appreciate honesty. We also appreciate gentle spanking once in a while.   Just F.Y.I.

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: One more thing... There... might be a picture of Precious   on my coffee table.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Her name is Precious? Is she a purebreed or did you   pick her up at the pound?

lines.speaker: Mike
lines.text: Anyway, I just wanna give you a heads up.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Okay, oh and you know, if she gets upset, just scratch   her tummy and give her a liver snout. (laughs and hangs up the phone)
(there's knocking on the door which Phoebe opens)

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: Hi, I'm Precious, who are you?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: (stunned) I... I'm Phoebe.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: Phoebe? Mike's ex-girlfriend Phoebe, the love of   his life? That Phoebe?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Enchant (she holds out her hand, and they shake   hands)
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's apartment. Monica's carrying the laundry hamper   to their coffee table.]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, I can't wait for everyone at work to see these...   (plays with her hair to make the shells tingle again) Ow!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You go back to work tomorrow night, right?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: So if you want people to see them, then by definition   you're not  having them taken out... say, at the break of dawn?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Well, if I had them taken out, then I wouldn't be   able to do this. (she pushes Chandler on the couch and brushes her   hair and shells against Chandler's chest) You like that, right? (again, she   brushes her hair against his chest and hums...)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: What are you singing?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: It's "Bolero" from "10".

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: It's "Ride of the Valkyries" from "Apocalypse   Now"...   See, here's the thing: The corn rose were really a solution to your frizzy   hair problem. And now that we're home, we don't have that problem anymore,   so if you think about it... I hate them!

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You what? You said you liked them.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Did I? Let's refresh. I believe what I said was   that I could see your scalp.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Fine, so you don't like them. Everybody else does.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Again, let's journey back... As I recall what Rachel   said, was  she had never notice the shape of your skull before. And Joey...   Well, Joey didn't realise that there was anything different.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: You know what? I don't care. I like it like this,   and I'm gonna keep it. You're just jealous because your hair can't do this...   (and she shakes her head more violently) OUCH!

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Hit yourself in the tooth?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: And the eye!
[Scene: Ross's apartment.Someone's knocking on the door. Ross rushes to the   door and it's Rachel with Emma.]

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (gasps) Hi... There she is. Hi Emma. Oh my God, I missed   you. (kisses her) Oh Emma, I missed you so much. Hey... Did you have   a good time with grandma Green? Huh? Did she give you a bottle of anti-depressants   again to use as a rattle? (to Rachel)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: That was one time, Ross, and they were only like   5 milligrams.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Ooh hey, Emma, daddy has some presents for you okay?   Okay? I want you to wait right here. Come here sweetie.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Aaah... Ross, actually there's something that I really   need to talk to you about.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (unpacking his bag) Okay, shoot!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay, uhm... alright, here's the deal.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: (gasps) OH NO!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: What? What is it?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, major shampoo explosion!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Uh, look Ross, this really isn't easy.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, it's all over everything. Why?   Why me? (looks up)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Because you took three hundred bottles of shampoo?

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: I'm sorry, I'm sorry. You were saying?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Well, yeah... Okay, look it's about me and...

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Oh, not another one! Oh my G... And this is moisturiser.   It's even harder to clean! Why? Why do bad things happen to good people?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Wow! Well, clearly this is not a good time.

lines.speaker: Ross
lines.text: Duh, you think? (enters the kitchen)
[Scene: Mike's place. Phoebe is on the phone.]

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Okay, bye. Alright, so Mike's on his way over. See,   you thought you guys were meeting here, and he thought you were meeting at   the restaurant, so you know... Doesn't really matter who's right or wrong.   Point is... I'm gonna take off.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: I'm not letting you leave until you tell me what's   going on here. I mean, are you guys getting back together or something?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Alright... Susie, can I call you Susie?

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: My name is Precious.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Yeah, I can't say that. uhm... Susie, I'm gonna be   straight with you... Mike and I are back together... and uhm... unfortunately   that effectively ends your relationship with him. And he's very sorry about   that and wishes you the best of luck in all your endeavours.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: I just can't believe this... Why?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Well, I don't...

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: Oh, why would he do this? I mean, what's wrong   with me?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Nothing, there's nothing wrong with you.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: I mean, what the hell am I supposed to do now?

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Damn it woman, pull yourself together! Have  some pride, for the love of God.
(Precious starts crying)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Okay, not a fan of the tough love.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: I just can't believe that Mike didn't give me any   warning.

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: But he didn't really know, you know. He wasn't planning   on coming to Barbados and proposing to me...

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: He proposed to you? This is the worst birthday  ever.   (she starts to cry again)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: Look, Precious... Mike's not worth this.   You're an attractive, intelligent woman and let's face it, Mike's kind of a   wang. I mean, he proposed to me while he was still seeing you... He was gonna   break-up with you on your birthday? And, I don't like to kiss-and-tell,   but he cheated on you a lot this weekend.

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: Oh, my God, maybe you're right. Maybe I don't need   him. I deserve to be treated with respect.
(Mike enters the apartment.)

lines.speaker: Precious
lines.text: Screw you, Mike. You're a coward and a bastard,   and I hope you rot in hell.
(she slaps him in the face, Mike looks like he  doesn't believe what just happened. Precious leaves, and he turns to Phoebe.)

lines.speaker: Phoebe
lines.text: You're welcome!
[Scene: Chandler and Monica's. Only Chandler is in the living room and walks   to the bathroom.]

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Honey, you've been in there for a long time...   Is everything okay?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Not really.
(Chandler enters the bathroom, and Monica is standing there in a towel, with   her hair stuck in the shower curtain.)

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: I have a problem.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Really? What happened?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Well, I was dancing around, and singing "No Woman,   No Cry" and I got stuck.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: You can't move at all?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Oh, well, I can move... (she moves back and forth   the shower curtain rail, opening and closing the shower curtain with her hair   as she goes)

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: If I untangle you, will you please get rid of the corn rose?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: (looking disappointed) I guess so...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (trying to untangle her) Some of these look a little   frayed.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Yeah, I tried to gnaw myself free.
[Scene: Rachel and Joey's apartment. Joey enters.]

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Hey!

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Hi!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: So, did you err... did you tell Ross?

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Well, I tried, but then he had a shampoo related   emergency. So I guess now it's your turn again.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no... I think it's better   if you tell him, you know. It's easier for a woman. That way, you know, if   he gets mad, all you have to do is go... I didn't mean it. I'm so so--ooory. (he   pushes  his breasts together from the side)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Yeah, 'cause that's what we do.

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Alright, alright, okay, uhm... How 'bout this, how   about this? Tomorrow... tomorrow we'll both go and we'll tell him together.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay, that sounds fair. It just means that once again   we can't...

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: I know, I know..., but that's okay. I mean, we can   control ourselves, we're not animals.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: No! Of course we can wait. Alright, so I guess that   means good night then?

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Yeah! Good night! (they give each other a small kiss   on the mouth, and stare at each other for a while)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Goo--ood night!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Good night! (they give each other a kiss again, but   this time it lasts longer)

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Seriously, good night!

lines.speaker: Joey
lines.text: Stop saying good night.

lines.speaker: Rachel
lines.text: Okay.

(Now they kiss passionately... and then Ross enters with Emma. They freeze,   pull away and look at Ross who looks like he just can't believe what he's seeing.   Joey straightens his shirt, and Rachel says I'm so-oo sorry, and   presses her breasts together, just like Joey did before.)
COMMERCIAL BREAK
[Scene: Monica and Chandler's. Monica walks in with one of those knitted Rasta   hats.]

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Look what I found in the drawer... (Chandler looks   up from his book.) And you said I'd never wear this...

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: Now that I untangled you, how 'bout you doing a   little something for me?

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Sure, what do you have in mind?

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: I think you know.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Really? I don't really feel like it.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: This is what I want to do.

lines.speaker: Monica
lines.text: Okay, I just don't get why you like it so much.

lines.speaker: Chandler
lines.text: (Picks up the "Miss Congeniality" DVD) She's an   FBI agent, posing as a beauty contestant.
THE END
